snippet: Who wants their babies kissed or their yard signs autographed anymore? Presidential candidates now have no choice but to submit to smartphone-wielding crowds.
abstract: Presidential hopefuls on campaign trail are frequently being asked to indulge supporters and pose for selfies; political strategists question whether blocking out time for selfies is actually effective or meaningful form of engagement with voters, given that it is unclear whether those who wish to have photos are interested in voting for candidates or merely want celebrity souvenir.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Who wants their babies kissed or their yard signs autographed anymore? Presidential candidates now have no choice but to submit to smartphone-wielding crowds.

headline.main: Facing a Selfie Election, Presidential Hopefuls Grin and Bear It
headline.print_headline: Photo-Op 2016: Of the People, by the People
